knimeNode.name: R Console
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows execution of R commands on an R Server within this node's view. The results are also displayed in the view.

fullDescription.intro:
Allows execution of R commands on an R Server within this node's view. The results are also displayed in the view. The entire data (compatible to int, double, and String types) is transfered to the R Server which then reacts to R commands entered in the view. Each column can be accessed by the name provided in the input data table. Missing values are not supported yet.
R installation:
In order to get the R nodes running, you have to install the R-project first, see www.r-project.org. Also the R Server which responds to R commands has to be installed and running, see http://stats.math.uni-augsburg.de/Rserve
. Also make sure that you have the lastest available or compatible R-project version at hand. For Windows you may download an R Server for your R-project version. All other operating systems require the most recent clients (R-project installation). We offer downloads of current versions of R and R-Serve that are compatible with KNIME on our website. Please note that in the current version the R Server needs to be restarted from time to time. If an R node hangs, interrupt the R Server and restart it. Warnings and errors are printed in the R Server window.
fullDescription.option: The IP of the computer where the R Server is running, for example localhost with IP 127.0.0.1
The login name can be empty.
